intro: Paraboea wenshanensis, commonly known as the Wenshan paraboea, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
